page.title: 06AN AFTERNOONS WORK
page.content: "Colin has been cooking today, chef's day off. 2hrs off in afternoon;busy in the garden.We have a polythene tunnel - lettuces ready mid-May. Next spring hope to have 3 Shetland ewe lambs & a couple of pigs (weaners). At 5.00 Colin off again to Inn; he checks menu, lays tables, ready to open at 7.00. Popular dinner meals are; home made pate, venison or steak, fresh or smoked salmon, home produced ice-cream At height of season we can do 30 meals a night. I put children to bed. Colin is usually back by 11.30; working over 80 hours per week. I swap one evening per week with him. Maybe its just as well that the season is only 7 months long. We close the Inn during the winter, in common with other hotels & guest houses in Ballater.
